---
title: "R Workshop"
---

The R Workshop is intended for researchers and students who are more familiar with the R and RStudio environments in their workflows. Using the `dataharvester` package, this workshop will will interface with the Data-Harvester without needing to interact with Python code.

::: callout-important
Make sure that you have read the [Code of Conduct](/code-of-conduct.qmd) and the [FAQ](/faq.qmd), especially the "What are the pre-requisites?" section [here](/faq.qmd#pre-requisites). Essentially, you need to be familiar with R and RStudio to get the most out of this workshop.
:::

## RStudio Cloud

This workshop will be run in RStudio, but you may also use RStudio Cloud where *most* dependencies have been installed for you. The exception is Google Earth Engine authentication, which you will need to do yourself.

If you are using RStudio Cloud, you will need to sign up for an account. You can do this [here](https://rstudio.cloud/). Once you have an account you can join our shared space by clicking the button below:

[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Join%20Shared%20Space-RStudio%20Cloud-yellow?style=for-the-badge&logo=appveyor)]()

If you do not have these installed, please follow the instructions in the [R Setup Page](/rdocs/r01-setup.qmd).
